chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Kristin Vallejo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:36 PM Defendant Rebecca Kristin Vallejo in court.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Rebecca Kristin Vallejo.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Cassidy calls the case and states the appearances. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY to Count 2

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2. 
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Atty Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Bergner makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Ms. Vallejo makes a brief statement to the court.

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1- Dismissed, read in

Count 2- 
Pay fine in amount of $150 plus costs
Pay within 60 days or setup payment plan

Count 3- Dismissed, read in

3:51 PM Defendant Rebecca Kristin Vallejo in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler appears on behalf of Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Rebecca Kristin Vallejo. 

3:52 p.m.  Officer C Stankowski is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Mutcher.
3:54 p.m.  ADA Mutcher has criminal complaint filed as exhibit #P1.
Witness identifies the defendant.
BY THE COURT:  Record reflects that the witness has identified the defendant.
3:56 p.m.  ADA Mutchler would ask that exhibit #P1 be entered into evidence.  No objection by Atty Bergner.  Received by the Court.
Cross examination by Atty Bergner.
4:00 p.m.  Redirect by ADA Mutchler.
Witness is excused.
ADA Mutchler has no further witnesses.
Atty Bergner has no witnesses.
ADA Mutchler has no argument.
Atty Bergner gives final argument and would ask that Count 1 be dismissed.
Court asks for clarification from Atty Bergner on his final argument.
Atty Bergner makes additional statements. 
4:03 p.m.  ADA Mutchler makes argument to the request of Atty Bergner.
Court questions element 6 and makes statements on the record.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

1:38 PM Defendant Rebecca K Vallejo appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of WI.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Rebecca K Vallejo. 

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct, Battery/Threat to Law Enforcement, Obstructing/Resisting an Officer. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Atty Soule states the defendant is eligible for public defender representation. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
